CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 19, 1945, pg. 2, reads: "Tomorrow's Housing! Post-War World to Bring New Conception of Homes and Building; Big Job Now, However, Is to Improve and Protect Present Realty Investments and Holdings Until That Time  - Left: Free Rent Plus Danger - Condemned for two years, this house in Lower Third Ward still houses occupants - rent free - who refuse to move.  Inspectors say the house may collapse at any moment... - Harris Photos." A portion of accompanying article by Dorothy Anderson reads: "The failure of the State Legislature to pass the sorely-needed House Bills 1131-1132 for relief of congested slum areas was a blow to all who have investigated to condition of the Hill District.  The housing situation in Pittsburgh and surrounded communities is decidedly not one which induces a spirit of levity in one who gives it more than a cursory examination..."
TitMainTitle: Brick row house with exposed party wall, next to vacant lot with makeshift fence, Hill District
